"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55022ec8636872189bfd0000#post_55022ec8636872189bfd0000
[bq="SidewardManatee"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55022e846368722c8d930900#post_55022e846368722c8d930900
!http://media.tumblr.com/2b5b25e32de6a047308f642557b119cb/tumblr_inline_nl2h8u6J5L1s8wcxp.gif![/bq]
I'm not saying it'll be bad; I personally think it'll be worth the watch, but my money is on the anime industry is going to go fucking ballistic about monster girls considering that the anime is going to be successful.

I think it'll be about a 8.5/10, but what is going to happen a couple months after it starts to air is, "Sir; we've just read the sales for our competitor's new anime show 'daily life with monster girl' and it's unimaginably financially successfull!" "Why is it so popular?" "The reviewers are saying that they love it cause it has monster girls in it" "Let's make anime about monster girls too then to emulate their success!"


To use an analogy let's imagine a world where say mecha anime never existed, but there were mecha manga then someone made a mecha anime; regardless of what it was about all those mecha fans would all swarm on that anime and cause it to be financially successful therefore causing other anime studios to try to emulate their success by making their own mecha anime.

Tl:dr; late 2015-2016 the year of the monster girls/monster boys.
